intro: Ornithogalum angolense, commonly known as the Angola lily, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical inflorescence bearing white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Ornithogalum angolense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
